description: A prehistoric island in Paradise that serves as a 'little garden' for giants. The island is home to dinosaurs and other extinct creatures, and features an hourly volcanic eruption that serves as the signal for Dorry and Brogy's duels.

keyEvents.title: Brogy's Introduction on Little Garden
keyEvents.description: Brogy crashes through Little Garden's jungle and encounters Nami and Usopp, defeating a T. rex in the process.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Little Garden as the home where the giants conduct their legendary duel.

keyEvents.title: Dorry's Introduction on Little Garden
keyEvents.description: Luffy and Vivi encounter Dorry in another part of Little Garden's prehistoric jungle.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the parallel nature of the island with both giants occupying different territories.

keyEvents.title: The Volcanic Duel Signal
keyEvents.description: It's revealed that Little Garden's volcano erupts every hour, serving as the signal for Dorry and Brogy to resume their century-long duel.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the unique environmental feature that governs the giants' combat schedule.

statusHistory.reason: Prehistoric island remains unchanged throughout the series

description: Brogy's campsite on Little Garden where he resides between duels with Dorry. The camp serves as his base of operations during his century-long stay on the island.

keyEvents.title: Nami and Usopp at Brogy's Camp
keyEvents.description: Brogy brings Nami and Usopp to his camp as guests despite their initial fear of him.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the hospitality of giant warriors even in the midst of their legendary duel.

description: Dorry's campsite on Little Garden where he resides between duels with Brogy. The camp is located at the opposite end of the island from Brogy's camp.

keyEvents.title: Luffy and Vivi Meet Dorry
keyEvents.description: Luffy and Vivi are welcomed at Dorry's camp where he explains the nature of his duel with Brogy.
keyEvents.significance: Provides exposition about the giants' century-long conflict and warrior culture.
